content.description:
In aquaeductumaquaeductus, -us, m.: aqueduct, domine, NicomedensesNicomedenses, -ium, m. or f. pl.: residents of Nicomedia impenderuntimpendo, -ere, -i: to spend HS HS XXX CCCXVIII = 3,318,000 sesterces (a form of Roman currency)
XXX CCCXVIIIHS XXX CCCXVIII = 3,318,000 sesterces (a unit of Roman currency), qui imperfectusimperfectus, -a, -um, adj.: unfinished adhuc omissusomitto, -ere, -misi, -missum = neglego, -ere, destructusdestruo, -ere, -struxi, -structum = perdo, -ere 
etiam est; rursus in alium ductumductum = aquaeductum erogata sunterogo, -are, -avi, -atum: to spend CCCC = 200,000 sesterces (a unit of Roman currency). Hoc 
quoque relicto, novo impendioimpendium, -i, n.: expense est opus.
content.question: Similar to Pliny the Younger’s letters to Trajan, which of the following Romans had their letters published after their death?

unit.text: 3: Pliny's Letters: Ghosts and Apparitions, Letters to Trajan and Calpurnia, and Teacher's Choice - Latin Prose

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
